Marshall Mathers often âstealsâ his ideas from 19th century goth poetry. Roger Alan Painter, famous goth writer, wrote the poem âCleaning out my Closetâ with verses nearly identical. When Roger Alan Painter wrote the poem, it was about the woe and depression of realising there is no god and no point in living and he is âclearing outâ the false memories in his life. Eminem reinterperated this to be thw woe and depression of realising there is no god and no point in living and also, his mother is a bit of a bitch. âMamaâ being a methophor for god who created this earth. I didn't mean to hurt you
I'm sorry that I made you cry
Oh no, I didn't want to hurt you
I'm just a jealous guy

compared to Eminem's:
I'm sorry, Mama.
I never meant to hurt you.
I never meant to make you cry,
but tonight I'm cleanin' out my closet.

Very different meanings but very similar choruses. It's also a lot like Queen's "Bohemian Rhapsody":

Mama 
Didn't mean to make you cry.

"Cleaning out my closet" is a great song, but my only issue with it is the chorus, which is so unoriginal up until the last line. I mean, who wants to try and go up against Lennon or Queen?

Wow, this song is why I love Eminem.  He has absolutely no qualms about telling the world about his life and his experiences.  He doesn't mince his words, he just "spits it better than 90% of rappers out there" (to quote another Eminem song) and lays his whole life clear for everyone to see.  Now that's courage.

It's especially moving for me, because I feel a lot of the same feelings towards my own mother, although not quote on the same level.  She kind of destroyed my childhood.  Listening to this song makes me cry, sometimes.
